summary: FBI 302 report documenting an interview with Metropolitan Correctional Center inmate Christopher Santos Felix regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein. Felix provides observations about the night of Epstein's death, guard behavior, and the discovery of the body.

persons.name: Christopher Santos Felix
persons.context: Inmate at MCC interviewed by FBI about the death of Jeffrey Epstein. Provided observations about guard checks, the discovery of Epstein's body, and Epstein's activities.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JEFF' by Felix. Found dead in his cell. Felix observed his body being removed and noted bruising on his face.

persons.name: Stone
persons.context: Referred to as Epstein's cell mate. Was taken to court on the Friday before Epstein's death and did not return that night.

connections.description: Felix was an inmate at MCC who observed Epstein's activities and the discovery of his body.
Stone was Epstein's cell mate at MCC, as reported by Felix.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. Guards discovered him during breakfast/head count. A male guard performed CPR.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day
events.description: Epstein went to legal meetings with his team from approximately 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM. His cell mate, Stone, went to court and did not return that night.

events.title: FBI Interview of Christopher Santos Felix
events.description: FBI agents interviewed inmate Christopher Santos Felix at MCC regarding Epstein's death. Felix provided observations about guard checks and the discovery.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Inmate Christopher Santos Felix stated guards did not perform proper rounds/checks the night Epstein died; the last check was between 12:30 AM - 1:00 AM.
Felix observed that when Epstein's body was removed, the rope was not over his head, he had bruising on his face, and earphones were still in place.
Epstein's cell mate, referred to as 'Stone', was taken to court on Friday and did not return the night before Epstein's death, leaving Epstein alone in the cell.
Felix reported no noise and no one entering Epstein's cell during the night after he returned from legal meetings.
The interview reveals potential security lapses and contraband/inappropriate behavior between staff counselors and inmates at MCC.
